properties.description: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.
properties.name: isValid

properties.description: The parent of the IndexOptions (a Document or Application).
properties.name: parent

properties.description: A collection of events.
properties.name: events

properties.description: A collection of event listeners.
properties.name: eventListeners

properties.description: The title of the generated index.
properties.name: title

properties.description: The paragraph style applied to the title of the generated index. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: titleStyle

properties.description: If true, replaces the content of the existing index. Note: Replaces only index content; does not update the index location or other index properties that may have been changed.
properties.name: replaceExistingIndex

properties.description: If true, includes topics and page references from all the documents in a book.
properties.name: includeBookDocuments

properties.description: If true, includes topics and page references on hidden layers.
properties.name: includeHiddenEntries

properties.description: The format for level 2 and lower index topics.
properties.name: indexFormat

properties.description: If true, displays the letters of the alphabet as index section headings.
properties.name: includeSectionHeadings

properties.description: If true, displays headings for sections with no index topics. Note: Valid only when include section headings is true.
properties.name: includeEmptyIndexSections

properties.description: The paragraph style applied to level 1 index topics.
properties.name: level1Style

properties.description: The paragraph style applied to level 2 index topics.
properties.name: level2Style

properties.description: The paragraph style applied to level 3 index topics.
properties.name: level3Style

properties.description: The paragraph style applied to level 4 index topics.
properties.name: level4Style

properties.description: The paragraph style applied to index section headings. Note: Valid when include section headings is true.
properties.name: sectionHeadingStyle

properties.description: The character style applied to page numbers in the index.
properties.name: pageNumberStyle

properties.description: The character style applied to cross references.
properties.name: crossReferenceStyle

properties.description: The character style applied to cross reference topics.
properties.name: crossReferenceTopicStyle

properties.description: The character(s) inserted after each index topic.
properties.name: followingTopicSeparator

properties.description: The character(s) inserted between index entries when runin-style index format is used for nested topics.
properties.name: betweenEntriesSeparator

properties.description: The character(s) inserted between page numbers to indicate a page range.
properties.name: pageRangeSeparator

properties.description: The character(s) inserted between separate page numbers, page numbers and page ranges, and series of page ranges.
properties.name: betweenPageNumbersSeparator

properties.description: The character(s) inserted at the start of cross references.
properties.name: beforeCrossReferenceSeparator

properties.description: The character(s) inserted at the end of each index entry.
properties.name: entryEndSeparator

properties.description: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.
properties.name: properties

methods.description: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the IndexOptions.
methods.name: toSource

methods.description: Resolves the object specifier, creating an array of object references.
methods.name: getElements

parameters.description: The event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
parameters.name: handler

parameters.description: The registered event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
parameters.name: handler
